subsc: Central government administration,Micro- and SME finance

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings of the Microfinance Project for
            Madagascar were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory; the risk to development outcome was moderate;
            the Bank's performance was moderately satisfactory; and
            the Borrower's performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included: the long term
            approach which ended being one prolonged phase was an
            excellent design feature that contributed to effective
            achievement of project objectives. Targeted interventions
            can contribute to inclusive financial systems by increasing
            participation and welfare of vulnerable groups as observed
            in this project. Good governance for member owned
            institutions such as the financial cooperative has been a
            key to achieving sustainability. Where issues for management
            action are raised in supervision reports, it is important
            for management to make quick decisions and take stern
            position to send a strong message to the borrower and
            rectify the situation before the damage is too big. During
            the political crisis, the Microfinance Institution (MFI)
            networks were resilient and continued to supervise their
            affiliates when the regulator was not able to do so due to
            political insecurity in the provinces.
